page.title: 14INDUSTRY EMPLOYMENT LUTON.
page.content: We went to Dallow Rd to find out about the industry. The new buildings were single storey and rather like matchboxes some were single units some were joined. We had expected smoke, noise and old buildings they were not like that. Some had TO LET signs up. Quite a few of the buildings were for storage. The firms included Leighton Stationers, cash and carry; Luton and Dunstable Engineering Training Centre; Huntleigh Technology, medical supplies; GWB productions, perfume bath soap; Darling, domestic wear; Road Express, collect and deliver; Massmould, plastic bottle tops. Jervis B.Webb make conveyor systems and have been in Luton since 1974, they are part of a US Detroit firm. They send products to many parts of the world. They employ 87 people. Factory workers are paid weekly in cash, office people monthly in bank.
